dmca.title: DMCA Complaint from Cricket Australia for cricketspot.com
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Kiernan [mailto:mikek@nr-online.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, January 24, 2007 9:27 AM
To: Copyright
Subject: RE: DMCA Complaint from Cricket Australia for cricketspot.com

Dear Sir,

Please see the site www.cricketzero.com/member. The attached screenshot
illustrates that the site is offering International Cricket streams of
the India v West Indies Series, infringing the copyright of our client
Echostar. I also attach a letter of authority from Echostar.

I hereby state that EchoStar is the sole owner of the rights referenced
above and that NetResult is authorized to act on its behalf with respect
to internet monitoring and compliance.

On behalf of the owner of the exclusive rights with respect to the
content at issue in this notice, I hereby state that I have a good faith
belief that use of such A/V in the manner complained of is not
authorized by the owner, its agent, or the law.

I, Mike Kiernan, as a representative of NetResult hereby digitally sign
this e-mail message under penalty of perjury under the laws of the
United States of America with the additional statement under penalty of
perjury that the information in the notice is accurate.

Regards, 

Mike Kiernan

Account Executive

Projector NetResult Ltd
Mulberry House,
583 Fulham Road,
London,
SW6 5UA 

mikek@nr-online.com
http://www.nr-online.com 

tel: +44 (0)20 7471 1733
  
-----Original Message-----
From: Copyright [mailto:copyright@theplanet.com]
Sent: 24 January 2007 15:17
To: mikek@nr-online.com
Cc: Theplanet@chillingeffects.org
Subject: FW: DMCA Complaint from Cricket Australia for cricketspot.com

 To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Kiernan [mailto:mikek@nr-online.com]
Sent: Monday, January 22, 2007 11:54 AM
To: Legal Response; Copyright
Subject: RE: DMCA Complaint from Cricket Australia for cricketspot.com

Dear Sirs,

Many thanks for taking action against this site.

It would be fantastic if similar action can be taken against
www.cricketzero.com/member. 

Please see the attached screenshot illustrating the infringement- the
site is offering streams of the India v West Indies Series, infringing
the copyright of our client Echostar. I also attach a letter of
authority from Echostar.  

Please contact me with any further questions that you might have.

Regards,

Mike Kiernan

Account Executive

Projector NetResult Ltd
Mulberry House,
583 Fulham Road,
London,
SW6 5UA 

mikek@nr-online.com
http://www.nr-online.com 

tel: +44 (0)20 7471 1733

-----Original Message-----
From: legal-response@theplanet.com [mailto:legal-response@theplanet.com]
Sent: 22 January 2007 17:33
To: mikek@nr-online.com; copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: DMCA Complaint from Cricket Australia for cricketspot.com

To Whom It May Concern:

This letter confirms that access to the materials referenced in your
below-pasted complaint has been disabled.

Legal Response Team
The Planet



---------


Please see the attached PDF.
